review_blob: It is, by far, the best low alcohol IPA I have tasted. Seems most of the low alcohol (below 6%) IPAs lack taste and aroma, but this one tastes and smells like a REAL IPA. I will definitely buy some of this and use it as a staple.
I received this as a gift. It showed a nice head after pour and I liked the taste. Very decent IPA and I would drink it again.
Cmon - this is not an IPA - citrus, fruity, wheat, etc. - give me a break! I am an IPA guy and like most of them but PLEASE!!

This came to me as a gift along with a Sam Adams IPA and some other beer I wouldnt comment on. It is a decent IPA but I probably wouldnt buy it because I have "house mouth - meaning I compare everything to Stone and this doesnt make it.

My palate doesnt allow me to be too particular, but I try every/all IPAs wherever I go. Stone IPA is my staple. I live in San Diego, buy it by the case at Costco and feed it to all my friends. I drink it every day and have no negative comments - it tastes great and its my favorite beer. I am 71 years old and have been a beer drinker for 50 years - this is my favorite of all time.

My favorite beer.  Obviously you cant sit with your buddies and pound it  all day long at 11.2%.  With this beer, you sit with a couple of buddies, crack open a growler and enjoy it for the taste, aroma, etc.  I does have a bitter, long aftertaste, which I like.
